books.title: The History of Henry Esmond
books.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
books.summary: A young nobleman of obscure birth sacrifices his own interests to uphold the honor of his patrons’ family.

books.title: The Secret of the Caves
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Four boys vacation at nearby caves only to be swept up in a mystery.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
books.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
books.summary: A poor young boy unexpectedly inherits a peerage and travels to England to live with his grandfather, an Earl.

books.title: Mr. Mulliner Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the eccentric (and hilarious) Mr. Mulliner, who regales the patrons of the Anglers’ Rest with tales of his colorful and amusing relatives.

books.title: The Power of Darkness
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Two Russian peasants tragically succumb to selfish, immoral temptations.

books.title: Khaled
books.author: F. Marion Crawford
books.summary: A powerful genie is condemned to live the life of a man, unless he can find true love.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by F. Scott Fitzgerald, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Turn of the Screw
books.author: Henry James
books.summary: A governess moves in to a haunted manor.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: The Valley of Fear
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The final novel in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s Sherlock Holmes series follows the eponymous hero as he investigates a Sussex murder seemingly connected with a secret society.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Sonnets from the Portuguese
books.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
books.summary: A collection of 44 love sonnets.

books.title: Captain Jinks, Hero
books.author: Ernest Howard Crosby
books.summary: A jingoistic military officer embarks on a tragicomic quest to become a “perfect soldier.”

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
